fullText: Despite moments of visual splendor and a few lovely songs, this musicalization of the Lewis Carroll classic lands with a thud.
dtliExcerpt: Despite moments of visual splendor and a few lovely songs, this musicalization of the Lewis Carroll classic lands with a thud.
bwwExcerpt: His lumbering period pieces have notched up some of the most consistently scalding reviews of any seasoned Broadway composer, but Frank Wildhorn keeps coming back, like indigestion. It would be gratifying to report that his latest musical, Wonderland, deserves a warmer welcome, but this clumsy Lewis Carroll update shuffles bland â€˜80s pop imitations and third-rate show tunes to minimal effect.
